ReviewList.Text: I've just started reading this book and haven't gotten very far in yet, but I am finding it easy to understand versus other textbooks that are filled with stale and dry explanations too hard to interpret. I've never taken a Physics course and needed a book that talked on my "layman level" and this book does a good job of bringing Physics to my understanding. For someone who's new to Physics as I am, or someone who needs a quick basic review, this book is a gem. And, of course, you can't beat the price!
It is a quite comprehensive guide book. Concise explanations but perhaps a bit reduced on details and depth. definitely a good option for 9-12 introductory Physics.
Basic overview.  Optics, waves, momentum, particles, heat, electromagnetism, energy, etc.  Good summary but very basic.  Don't look for in depth discussions.

Understanding of the physics principia involve a lot of tools, a huge lot of effort and compromise. Currently we need a begining for catching up with all of this. This book provides a smooth way of getting it! Step by step procedures during excercises, a really nice pages presentations, well desinged examples and many criteria for resolution left to the readers.

Otherwise really good for teaching yourself. Well thought out, laymen's terms, good organization. Only problem is when it refers to "figure 1.1" etc half the time they aren't there. I have a kindle keyboard though so I'm not sure if that's a factor
This book is one of the best kindle books I have had. Easy to read. Excellent contents. It is free!

In some places, the math expressions are unreadable e.g. three at locations 2999, one at 3030 etc. Some are steps in a review solution. Solutions and in general Math learning is often linear, having even a few roadblocks can prove frustrating, especially when the book is your only resource. Hope the later editions correct these.
Bought this to supplement Teaching Course videos I am watching.  Doing questions with my sophomore son.  I am loving it and he is dreading it.

I enjoy books like this that spark the imagination because when you keep an open mind and read a book like this you tend to see things from a different perspective. Enjoy learning new things and refreshing my memory of things learned long ago. Would recommend to others.
I liked it very much as it is presented in a very lucid manner.  Great book and great work by author
Too outline! If you already learned physics it is quick and good review book, but it is not for first time learner.
This is a cool review book with some interesting questions to do some head scracthing. Good to read on a train, a tram, a bus or a similar public transport.
Thanks so much!  This has been very helpful and  instrumental and the difference for my son's better grades in high school.

This book is definitely written for High School level and has good explanations for each subject.  It meet my requirements for a year long Engineering course at the high school level.  I will definitely use its examples for teaching connections to real life.  The price is right and has easy access.
Useless--the formulas are so tiny and blurry, that it is impossible to work with this.
The contents are too vague for deep studying and poorly written for a beginer.

Though I have not finished this book yet as I am treating it like a pnysics course instead of casual reading but my opinion so far excellant. It was written as a textbook and its easy to follow and review with.
This is a great tool to help supplement your child learning
